question: The concept of applying rudimentary statistical and computational tools to financial markets has been around for numerous decades.
Pairs trading is a financial trading strategy that involves strategically buying and selling two historically uncorrelated stocks.
The crux of the pairs trading strategy is to profit from the convergence of the two prices.
We propose the use of a deep reinforcement learning agent to attempt to minimize the potential profits observed in statistical arbitrage scenarios.
We will run statistical simulations of dozens of stocks in order to find a few pairs trading candidates that we will train our deep reinforcement learning agent on.
